Description: HR, SHR and CHR
OR, ROR and COR
SMR
RR, IRR and Coefficient of Aggravation
Beta, Unstandardized Regression Weight, IE and DE
R (Correlation coefficient)

The results below do not belong to any Estimator grouping
The chance of an event occurring in the treatment arm : the chance of an event occurring in the control arm
Name: Hazard Ratio
Label: HR

Match: shr|subhazard ratio|sub hazard ratio|subhazard|sub hazard|subdistribution hazard|sub distribution hazard|sub distribution hazard ratio
Description: The instantaneous rate of occurrence of the given type of event in subjects who have not yet experienced an event of that type
Name: Subhazard Ratio
Label: SHR

Description: The relative change in the instantaneous rate of the occurrence of the primary event in subjects who are currently event?free
Name: Cause-specific Hazard Ratio
Label: CHR

Match: smr|standardized mortality ratio|suicide related standardized mortality ratio|standardized mortality
Description: The ratio of observed deaths in the study group to expected deaths in the general population
Name: Standardized Mortality Ratio
Label: SMR

Description: The odds that an outcome will occur given a particular exposure, compared to the odds of the outcome occurring in the absence of that exposure
Name: Odds Ratio
Label: OR

Description: A measure of the odds ratio between two variables when a third variable is held at a fixed level
Name: Conditional Odds Ratio
Label: COR

Match: rr|rrr|risk ratio|relative risk|relative rate|relative rate ratio|relative risk ratio|ir|irr|incidence risk|incidence risk rate|incidence risk ratio|coefficient of aggravation|aggravation coefficient
Description: The ratio of the probability of an outcome in an exposed group to the probability of an outcome in an unexposed group
Name: Risk Ratio
Label: RR

Description: A measure of risk that compares the prevalence of a disease in an exposed group to the prevalence in an unexposed group
Name: Prevalence Ratio
Label: PR

Description: Estimate the relationship between nonfatal index self-harm episode characteristics and subsequent nonfatal self-harm and suicide
Name: Time Ratio
Label: TR

Match: ror|ratio of odds ratios|ratio of odds ratio|ratio of odds|Ratio of odds ratios (ROR)
Name: Ratio of Odds Ratios
Label: ROR

Match: b|B|beta|Beta|bc|beta coefficient|regression coefficient|stdb|std b|srw|src|standardized regression weight|standardized regression coefficient|standardized regression|standardized coefficient|standardized weight|Path coefficient|Path coefficients|Standardised pathway coefficient|Repeated-measure regression model estimate
Description: The standardized regression coefficient, which compares the strength of the effect of each individual independent variable to the dependent variable (the higher the absolute value of the beta coefficient, the stronger the effect)
Name: Beta
Label: Beta

Match: urw|unstandardized regression weight|unstandardized weight|unstandardized regression|urc|unstandardized regression coefficient|unstandardized coefficient|Unstandardized regression coefficient (B)
Description: The amount of change in a dependent variable Y due to a change of 1 unit of independent variable X
Name: Unstandardized Regression Weight
Label: URW

Description: A statistical measure of the strength of the relationship between the relative movements of two variables
Name: Correlation Coefficient
Label: R

Description: A ratio of suicide rate among divorced to suicide rate among married groups
Name: Coefficient of Aggravation
Label: COA

Match: ose|oes|overall size effect|overall effect size|Cohenâ€™s d|effect size|Effect
Description: The mean difference between groups in standard score form (used in meta-analysis)
Name: Overall Effect Size
Label: OES

Match: ie|indirect effect|indirect effect coefficient|indirect|Estimated Indirect Effect
Description: Measures the extent to which the dependent variable changes when the independent variable is held fixed and the mediator variable changes by the amount it would have changed had the independent variable increased by one unit (used in mediation analysis)
Name: Indirect Effect Coefficient
Label: IE

Description: Measures the extent to which the dependent variable changes when the independent variable increases by one unit and the mediator variable remains unaltered (used in mediation analysis)
Name: Direct Effect Coefficient
Label: DE

Description: Measures how much two cases that differ by one unit on one variable are estimated to differ on the other variable (used in mediation analysis)
Name: Total Effect
Label: TE

Description: A statistical estimate that combines information from multiple samples to estimate a common mean or variance
Name: Pooled Estimate
Label: PE

Description: A measure of the difference between the means of a variable in relation to its standard deviation
Name: Standardized Mean Difference
Label: SMD

Description: A measure of the difference in risk between two groups, and is calculated by subtracting the risk in the unexposed group from the risk in the exposed group
Name: Risk Difference
Label: RD

Description: A single value that's calculated from sample data to estimate an unknown population parameter
Name: Standardized Point Estimate
Label: SPE

Description: A measure of comparative risk that is used in epidemiology to show an increased amount of risk compared to a group without risk factors obtained by subtracting 1 from the relative risk
Name: Relative Excess Risk
Label: RER
